{"step_by_step_thinking": "Ketogenic amino acids are those that can be converted into ketone bodies, while glucogenic amino acids can be converted into glucose. Some amino acids can be both ketogenic and glucogenic. According to Document [3], five amino acids are both ketogenic and glucogenic: phenylalanine, isoleucine, threonine, tryptophan, and tyrosine. Therefore, the answer should be isoleucine.", "answer_choice": "A"}
